edu.gatech.seclass.utilities

Class ExternalWebService

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.gatech.seclass.utilities.ExternalWebService

  • public class ExternalWebService
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Erin Paciorkowski Created for GA Tech OMSCS CS 6300 Summer 2017 ExternalWebService class to mock cloud DB connection. This mock web service will not sync outside your device and will not persist data after the session. This class is a singleton. Use getInstance() instead of instantiating a new ExternalWebService. *

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ExternalWebService getInstance()

      • addCryptogramService

        public java.lang.String addCryptogramService(java.lang.String puzzle,
                                             java.lang.String solution)
                                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds cryptogram to list and return id if successful. Throws IllegalArgumentException if puzzle duplicates existing puzzle or solution, or if nonletter characters do not match, if capitalization does not match, or letter substitutions are inconsistent
        Parameters:
        puzzle - string representing the encrypted cryptogram
        solution - string representing the solution
        Returns:
        id for cryptogram if accepted
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • syncCryptogramService

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> syncCryptogramService()
        get the list of cryptograms
        Returns:
        list of cryptorgrams

      • syncRatingService

        public java.util.List<ExternalWebService.PlayerRating> syncRatingService()
        Get the list of all player ratings, unordered
        Returns:
        list of player ratings (PlayerRating contains String firstname, String lastname, int solved, int started, int incorrect)

      • updateRatingService

        public boolean updateRatingService(java.lang.String username,
                                   java.lang.String firstname,
                                   java.lang.String lastname,
                                   int solved,
                                   int started,
                                   int incorrect)
        input the player username plus parts of one player rating
        Parameters:
        username - player username
        firstname - player first name
        lastname - player last name
        solved - total number of cryptograms ever solved
        started - total number of cryptograms ever started/attempted
        incorrect - total number of cryptogram solutions ever submitted incorrectly
        Returns:
        true if successfully updated or added player rating, false if any values are null or empty or cannot add to player ratings

      • playernameService

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> playernameService()
        get list of player usernames, unordered
        Returns:
        list of player usernames
